17.52.text: take my doubt and sequester it?

20.06.text: With a public miracle or a television appearance

32.22.text:
but I’m going to carry on heedless if faith
is paramount and science needless

39.88.text:
you see it seems to me that if belief is key
then hell must be one hell of a party

44.72.text:
the great minds are there, I’ve no doubt
about it I’ll take this time though

56.40.text:
they talk to an omnipotent man in their mind
I sit back politely witnessing the absurd

61.36.text: as decisions are being made based on voices

69.80.text:
so you don’t
misconstrue what I’m saying

72.14.text:
ask any proud believer, 
this is essentially what they’re stating.

76.22.text:
They want to get to heaven 
which is reliant on them behaving

78.85.text:
but the laws of their lord 
are not open to debating

81.81.text:
so when push comes to shove 
the law or our land is a plaything

85.48.text:
they play by their own rules
and we’re expected to placate them

88.84.text:
there’s a voice in their head 
and they follow it's Will

93.04.text: and that’s fine when it says give to charity

95.76.text:
but sometimes it says kill and if its will
is to kill then they are willing and able,

104.32.text:
This ideology is frighteningly unstable, we
need to educate people

112.34.text: Now I know what’s coming next..

113.98.text:
“Well yeah but if you’d seen what I’ve seen
you wouldn’t be making such a scene..

117.50.text: ..I’ve experienced miracles man, God moved through me”

124.00.text: but with just a little read

125.46.text: you’d see your miracles can be explained

130.59.text: When you avoid proof and keep your distance

132.73.text: there’s a reason for that, they call it cognitive dissonance

135.68.text:
and when you decry facts
to justify what you believe in

138.70.text: there’s a name for that too, it’s called illogical reasoning,

142.88.text:
to avoid an emotional upheaving 
your mind will do almost anything

150.20.text: Now while I’m on the topic

154.12.text:
sitting on the fence wondering 
why I’m caustic, they say:

163.74.text: ...just let people think what they think"

170.44.text: Consider the time and lives wasted

173.52.text: we mightn’t have had the dark ages

176.90.text: and be flying around in spaceships

179.64.text:
instead we’re earthbound
bickering about gay relations.

187.55.text: but I know an author more enlightening than John,

191.11.text: his name is Dawkins he uses logic you can't refute

197.03.text: they helped free my mind from recluse.

202.21.text: The universe is cold and uncaring

214.08.text: but if you like it or not..

221.22.text: but you’ll still fall off the roof.
